review: It was my first time here we were started with agree appetizer which was good. We ordered vegetarian pizza and barbecue chicken pizza, barely any sauce or cheese on both pizzas just an average pizza,we were expecting more, I like how it's made fresh but the flavors were off. We ordered a salad with BBq chicken and it was delicious. The food is very overly priced for such small portions.

7 months pregnant, almost 100 degrees outside and my toddler urgently needed to use the restroom so I thought, perhaps, they would allow me to use the restroom at CPK. It was my first time visiting Riverside Plaza so I didn't realize there was a public restroom. Nonetheless I was hoping they would be understanding at CPK and help a momma out. The older woman with dark black hair who opened the door greeted me kindly until I asked if my toddler could please use the restroom. She looked annoyed, completely changed her attitude, and told me coldly that in the future I needed to use the public restroom and pointed in some direction outside. While I sort of understand why they have these "policies" but I wasn't really asking for too much - a little kindness from one human to another perhaps? I wondered: if I were a man would this woman have treated me the same? If I were white?  Would it have mattered if she knew I were a doctor? None of that should matter.  I shouldn't have to show credentials (by way of skin color, gender, or degrees) to be treated with a little respect and humanity. But I am quite certain that any of those descriptors would have changed the way she responded to me. Anyway, recognizing that I was not wanted I went ahead and told her "okay I will go find the public restroom." When I arrived it was closed.  This was my first experience at this CPK and will likely be my last. I hope that the door lady feels wonderful and powerful knowing she upheld the all-important "customers only" restroom policy at CPK.  Pretty sad...

CPK....I'm kinda biased.  I love this place.  The service is usually spot on and this one did not disappoint.  I ordered the Santa Fe spring rolls and my buddy got the all mixed meats pizza.  Both items came out together and in a timely manner.  Both were piping hot as well.  The ice tea glass was never less than half full before refilling by staff.   This location is in an extremely busy center.  The wait was 15-20 minutes, but we walked right in at the bar.  If you make it over to this location, expect to wait, but give it a whirl!

Very friendly service. Felt welcomed the second we walked in. Had advised them that it was our first time visiting and they brought out a complementary flat bread that was delicious. A little pricey, however is worth the money.

The food was very tasty but my review is for Nate. He went above and beyond to give us amazing customer service. It's not every day that one comes across with a person that loves what they do and realizes that customer service matters and that great customer care results in a successful business. Truly appreciated his service and enjoyed our time here tonight.

Good food, bad service.  Wasn't busy at all, and it's a Monday night. Hostess was great, our server Rebecca was terrible..   Only time she came by was to take out order and drop the bill. Had to flag her down for wrong toppings on pizza. Had to flag her down for the dessert menu. Flag her down for a refill, I was about to flag her down for the bill too. I could write a more detailed review, but for what.  What's written up there should be enough for anybody to judge their service...

Brittany the best server. She also very knowledgeable  about the menu.  Really good marguerita  pizza and tostada pizza (with chicken added). The chicken  lettuce wraps were good ( the dipping sauce good). They changed up their potstickers. No longer fried, they are steamed.  The bbq chicken salad great as always.   I prefer the old dipping sauce over new dipping sauce for the potstickers. Really good good. Great service. Laura and Brittany are both #1. We had lots of leftovers.

I went to this restaurant especially for the Chopped Salad.  It wasn't chopped and everything about it was different.  The dressing, it was not crisp and it cost me $20! The waitress was very nice but the salad was so different in texture and taste I think they have sold the chain.  It was busy so someone likes it. I'll never go back.

Absolutely incredible experience! The manager Irene heard from our server that it was our first time and gave us outstanding service. We tried the Hearth Roasted Halibut and loved it! Would definitely recommend to anyone that enjoys intricate cuisines and an amazing staff.

Pizza was good! We also had wontons as appetizer and the Waldorf chicken salad. Everything was good. Came out crazy fast. The ambience is chill slow kinda in the early dinner time the server was friendly and checked on us enough. :)
Our server, Amanda, was really nice and attentive! The BBQ chicken pizza and BBQ chicken salad go really good together too, perfect summer lunch!
ice clean atmosphere. Great lunch deals. Good portions. BBQ chicken pizza is the bomb! Asian chicken salad is great!

A good place to go if you want pizza in a casual environment but nicer than Pizza Hut, dominos, or other similar eateries. The restaurant is very stylish and they have a wide selection of food. The pizza isn't the best I've ever had and it's somewhat pricey, which is why I'm only giving it 4 stars. However my dining experience here has always been pleasant, except for one time a bug crawled on the table but even then it was was an overall a positive experience haha. The wait staff is professional and courteous, their healthy meals are tasty, and it is a pleasant environment to eat. I would recommend eating here.

First and last time ever going here. Our waitress Alexis was very rude first of all. Had no clue on what is being served in the kitchen. Nor does she know if her own restaurant offers WiFi for customers. I couldn't tell if she was unhappy working there or if she disliked my family and I for being Hispanics or something, I did not enjoy being there at all.
This place is dirty af. Third really lame visit here in a row. Tonight's waiter is good though .

(Written by Anita Bonner) We just left one of our favorite spots to get dinner. Not busy but they had a couple of large party's already seated. Our drink orders were taken by the hostess. As we sat at our table without service. I looked around to see who our server might be hoping they would see us in their section. I made eye contact with a chef (in a white jacket) walking by. He immediately came over to our table and asked if we'd been helped. We told him no and he took our order. During this time our server came over very apologetic stating she had a large party she was attending to. She made jokes with the chef and left to place our order. CPK like most restaurants has shared servers so we received our order from another server. I asked the server if he'd bring us extra dressing for our salads. He said yes but never returned. We started eating waiting for the salad dressing after about 7or8 minutes I went to the bar to ask for the dressing. Another server brought it to the table. By the time our server came back to our table we were nearly finished eating. I told her her that I didn't feel that she gave us the best service tonight. She asked why and I explained that she never came to the table even after she had apologized for not being attentive in the beginning of her service. I had to go to the bar and ask for the salad dressing we also needed refills. She went to get the refills and brought it back to the table. We never saw her again. Instead a manager came to the table (She was possibly sent) asked if we needed anything... I asked for our check. After we paid we explained how the service had been and shared our disappointment. Again she apologized and thank me for sharing my concerns she also offered me a $15.00 gift card. I didn't accept the gift card but I did accept the apology. We always have a choice in where we spend our hard earned dollars. Poor service is never acceptable.

From the get go, our server Jude was very well spoken, well mannered, knowledagble, and extremely fast with any and all requests we had. We experienced a small problem during our experience. My girlfriend's cocktail had a small bug(in a strawberry). I sympathize with the staff because I know that it's not entirely their fault, nor is it our servers fault. But Jude was extremely professional and apologetic. His manager returned to our table, as well as the bartender to ensure we were completely happy. The chef even came out and brought us our dishes when they were ready. The staff really did go above and beyond on a busy Friday night to ensure me and my girlfriend were completely satisfied. I will be coming back soon and will be requesting Judes section.  I ordered the Moroccan chicken salad and it was absolutely amazing. Probably one of the best salads I've ever had. It had dates, eggplant, beets and a champagne vinaigrette. Really complex flavors, and to be frank not usually something I expect from a franchise restaurant. Definite kudos to the chef.  We also ordered the Silician pizza. Pretty solid. The sausage was very very good, and the crust was baked well. Will be back soon
I had a wonderful experience w/ our server Melissa. She is fantastic & adorable. It takes a lot to provide good service and she handled it! Thank you!!
This was our first time going to this location and we got impeccable service from all the staff. The manager, Riza, is amazing!! Definitely will return to this CPK very soon.

Hadn't been to CPK in about 2 years since we didn't have one in Texas.. Just left there & I must say I cannot wait to go back! Exceptional customer service. My husband ordered The Works pizza and I had the Tequila Chicken Fettuccine. For desert we had the butter cake. It was all so delicious! Our waitress was Raiza. She was amazing! We asked what she recommend as far as wine and desert and she was on point! The manager at the time found out that we had not been there in a good while & brought us a complimentary appetizer. At the end of the meal Raiza brought us a cookie to go with a card, welcoming us back. My husband & I cannot wait to go back & will definitely recommend it to our family & friends.
Excellent Service and great food. Had the lunch special of Pepperoni pizza and a Caesar salad.

We came for a mother's day lunch with a total of 7 people and 2 babies, the wait was 20 min. We waited 20 which turned into 25 we asked if our table was ready we were told it was being prepared for us and will be ready shortly. The wait turned into 30 to 35 minutes, at this point were getting annoyed we ask once more of our table is ready as we see several empty tables available. We were told that sorry were not getting a table because they  have tables for 13 and a few of 9 that called in . So at this point were not getting a table. Very rude, and inconsiderate don't lie and say our table is being prepared and then say we're not going to be seated .

Business students attending UC Riverside should be familiar with this place. The good o' spend $30 a meal for extra credit. Bring a friend to split $15/15! Professor Jasso sure does know how to strike a deal. I'm pretty sure I've spent at least $80~ dollars here over the course of four years. So for now, I'm on a bit of a CPK break, okay?  Anyways, CPK does serve some good food. The dining experience is nice with a darkly lit ambience and the waiters are always excited to serve. It does get hectic when its busy causing it to be difficult to flag down your server. Nevertheless, my dining experience was good.  On the contrary, I don't order pizza here. I usually get the Pesto Cream Penne with sun-dried tomatoes and chicken. This dish is so delicious, I love the pesto and sun-dried tomatoes. Prices are so expensive though. Definitely shouldn't be a regularly visit.  Now that I'm done with my college career, my yearly CPK visits are finally over! I'll visit a CPK again one day, but certainly not anytime soon.

Very disappointing. Table for 2.  Wife loves this place, and I used to enjoy it. Was seated by the hostess, then waited...and waited.  Table is seated next to us,  has 8 folks with toddlers.  An immediate convergence of service and attention on the crowd, while our table of 2 just sits.   Left and went to Panera, much better experience. The service used to be good at CPK, but now they just seat you while voicing their promotions, then forget about you.   DT

We had a good time. Had the kiddos so asked for the option to sit on the patio under the night summer sky. I ordered the Chimay reserve by accident but we made the$15 bottle worth the buy. We ordered their Maine Lobster Flat bread, Jambalaya Fettuccine, a kids crispy chicken and kids personal pizza. The first two were plenty enough for us two and our two girls to share delectably. Both dishes had just enough spice flavor. When you order off of the kids menu, you already know what they like or don't. The crispy chicken wasn't horrible, but it leaned toward the drier side tonight. You can't go wrong with the pizza so that was gone. We had a friendly wait staff. We were seated and served timely and nicely, and the patio was the perfect environment for us there!

I haven't actually eaten at CPK in a while. I stopped in this time to get a drink.  But I will say service here was great, bartenders were lively and while waiting to see a movie a couple of drinks for $16 isn't bad at all.
We love this restaurant , Irene is one of the best managers I have ever seen. She goes extra mile to serve you better. Food is always delicious and fresh.
Good service ... Ricky at the bar always takes care of us in a timely manner ... the food is always great as well.

My first time and I'm now a huge fan! Food was fantastic, service was great! Raiza, our server was so friendly and helpful! The manager came by our table to greet us and take our drink order. Love this place and I hate that is so far and none where I live

Okay so we went there and the server was uber nice. Im mad I forgot her name but that my issue not hers. The food was slow coming out.  They comped our entire meal so I tipped big. Great recovery by management.  Kudos.

I absolutely love the new design of the restaurant. They did a fantastic job freshening up and making the place feel current. The old interior design was screaming 1999 so it was long overdue. The new design of the menu is a little more simplified and the offerings for lunch are fantastic. Great new selections. The overall flavor of the food is great, I had a lunch combo with a spinach salad with apples, walnuts and cranberries, and the pepperoni pizza. To drink I had an awesome refreshing strawberry mango cooler with fizz.   Great refresh cpk!

I love halibut, and I was very sorprised to see it on the menu, it was absolutely delicious, the key lime pie was perfect Amanda our server is such a nice lady she made us feel at home, thank you for an amazing experience!

The food is good, the drinks are good, the dessert is good, the service is great. Juan is the best bartender ever, I don't know how he put up with us to be honest. He suggested some good drinks and was friendly the whole time. I would definitely recommend.

Came here on a Saturday night with some friends. The food we had was fantastic, the service was not. We were sat near the bar and the bartenders forgot about us often. Waited 10 mins for napkins and got 1 refill in 90 minutes. I also had to flag them down just to get them to pick up the check. Left a note with the hostess to give to the manager but not sure it was delivered. I love the food but I should've just got takeout.

The service (from Warren) was wonderful and the grilled ribeye was superb! It was cooked to perfection and the accompanying salad was delicious with a light vinaigrette. The roasted potatoes were a bit bland, but everything else was worth the visit!

Always, always a fulfilling meal. Been here so many times and have been satisfied every single time.  My last visit was on Valentine's Day & I really enjoyed their spicy chicken pasta . They had a 2 for $32 meal! It came with two entrees, 1 appetizer & 1 desert! Sooooo yummy. Oh, don't forget to try the white wine sangriaaaaaa. It is too good.
I love it the new spice buffalo cauliflower its delicious for entre...and the fettuccine Alfredo sooo perfect.....the greater serves Warren thanks for be my serve

CPK is delicious but wouldn't come here just because.  Like many business majors at UCR, I come here because of a certain professor's class.  The service here is usually nice, considering i come between lunch and dinner rush. The atmosphere had a very calm but welcoming aura that when we are seated we can enjoy our meal. I usually get the garlic cream fettuccine with chicken and mushrooms to meet the $15 mark. Definitely something I always enjoy and the taste is pretty consistent! You can also ask for additional sauce for no charge at all! My friends usually get the pizzas which is their specialty. The thai chicken pizza is good if you like that peanut sauce taste and the margarita pizza cant go wrong. If you want something more meaty, there is the mushroom pepperoni and sausage that a lot of my guy friends enjoyed. They do offer light entrees but I never feel like its worth it. But their salad portions are HUGE! Definitely filling.

Boyfriend & I came here for the first time a few days ago & we will definitely be returning! Maybe a little pricey but totally worth it! Ryan was our server & he was great! Really on top of everything & gave the best recommendations. Great environment, great service, great food! :)
Our server Brittany provided exceptional service, accuracy, and kindness. They gave us extra appetizers too at no charge. Very kind folks. Fun vibe. Great food!

We have been here six or seven times over the last five months and have not been disappointed one time! The salads are fresh and cold with great presentation and we have only had the thin crust pizza and it has always been very good!!

Good Bbq chick pizza. Sweet and tangy. Real thin crust. Great management. Our server was busy but was always checking on us. I wish this place has a happy hour. The Caesar salad we had was in the dry side. The kids pepperoni pizza was BAD. Tasted like out of a microwave. I'm being nice with a three star!

My boyfriend and I love this place. The atmosphere is great and so is the food. We normally would go for a movie right after wards. He loves the Kung pow spaghetti and I always have the Thai crunch salad. At the very end my dessert always finishes with a sundae and sprinkles.

My brother and I took my mom here for Christmas Eve dinner... she had never been to a CPK. Haters always hate on chain restaurants like this, but I've always liked CPK.  We ordered the mushroom pizza, jamaican jerk chicken pizza, cobb salad, and the corn-avocado stack appetizer. CPK has a new menu of apps around $3, which is pretty nifty. Ours was forgotten, so we got it on the house. The food wasn't something I'd crave or really want to come back for, but it was good. The jerk chicken pizza pulled off the spicy/sweet combo in an unusual way. I actually liked the salad the best, even though it was so simple.  I don't usually go to CPK to get slizzard.... it's usually for a work lunch for family thing, so I didn't notice how CHEAP wines by the glass were! There wasn't much over $6! I took advantage and had two. My mom was there, after all. Wine and beer selection is a little lacking, but it's cheap. Maybe it was the company, but we had a great Christmas Eve dinner here, lingering, catching up, telling stories, and talking shit. Just how a good family gathering should be. Service was stellar and we felt very comfortable.

Have not ventured into a CPK in awhile and I might be returning to this one soon. It started out as a long wait to be seated (25-30min) but was shorten to less than 20. Server was Andre and explained very well the new selections and answered all our questions well and as a good server does, got us to pick a drink from their bar. Orders the Italian chopped salad (yum) and the wild mushroom pizza. Only negative I had was that the crust was slightly burnt. Ended the night with walking off the food around the Plaza and watching One11 rock out just outside. Loved it.
Very nice food and place. Suitable for families with kids. They can add or change the recipes for what you like. Our server Hayley was awesome and take care of us.

Wow! This place is hopping!! Cyndi & Cesily were on it!! Thanks ladies :) Actually there was a great vibe going on with all the staff.  Now for the food. I've been to CPK before but this was the first time I ordered the pear & Gorgonzola pizza. So delish!
Ordered a BBQ chicken pizza - came with no chicken . Seriously ? Was ignored by the server multiple times . Terribad

There is a great variety of food and different pizza choices but I honestly enjoyed the rolls more than the actual pizza tho, it didn't stand out too much for me and for the prize I think I could have gotten a better pizza at dominos ! The service is great and the waitress was very nice.

The Chino Hills location is topps! Riverside location couldn't possibly stay open much longer. It's terrible!!!! Went at 11 when they opened.  Ordered: Spinach artichoke dip- chips were stale, dip tasted and looked old.  Arnold Palmer- tea was instant and not brewed, unlike Chino Hills. The lemonade was watery and lacked flavor. Waitress brought only 1 refill for my guest, never brought me one, but it was terrible anyway. Pizza- lacked flavor... How do you mess up a pizza? Aragula salad- looked sloppy, the cheese was a torn up slice of cheese- very sloppy. Nasty- dont order it! Glad i had a gift card and coupon. I will never go back to this location. If you want good food,  don't eat in Riverside. Blecht!!!!!! Oh, and waitress never brought us bread... Disappointing!

My family and I have eaten at few different CPKs, but this by far has the friendliest staff!! The food here is ok, but it's the service that made this experience amazing. Our server, Hayley, was such a joy! She had an amazing personality and the rest of the staff, just as great. If I ever come back to a CPK it'll be this one.
Their pizza is good.  The crust used to be better.  They shouldn't of changed it.  But their salads and desserts are great.  Drinks are great too but pricey.

Today I order the works pizza.  At first, it had everything that should have it on the works pizza except the cheese. I mean very little cheese that I can bearly see it and taste it.  So I told my waiter and he told her manager what happened.  The manager not only add more cheese on my pizza but she took it off from the check.  Later she came to our table with a great smile to apologize that had happen with our food and thank us for our patience.  Everyone here are such a nice people with great service!!

I've been to several California Pizza Kitchen but  this location is one of my favorites.  CPK has a variety of items on it menu such as a variety of different pizza topping combination, to pasta entrees, & sandwiches for those who may not want pizza. First of all, ever time I've come into eat here I'm greeted by a friendly happy host & I've never have had to wait to be seated more than ten minutes. And the waiter or waitress have been quick to come and get a drink order while we look over the menu & they are quick to point out whatever specials they currently have. Secondly, after our order is taken our salads & appetizers are promptly on our table within 7mintue or so. And if the appetizers we order are supposed to be hot it comes out hot like the flat bread I ordered. However, if its supposed to be cool like the salad I ordered then it served cool. Thirdly, the pizza crust is always perfectly cooked  crispy & which ever combination of topping the menu describes is what is on the pizza. Finally,  there you have my four star review & I only have  four stars is because I haven't tried half of the items on the menu enjoy!

Phoned in an order & Kenneth took my order- The best customer service I have had in quite a while anywhere. He was helpful, professional, and most importantly had a great sense of humor! I was pleasantly surprised because I have been the recipient of poor customer service recently and it was so refreshing that this young person has the concept and attitude if great customer service.

I came in here on Veterans Day to receive my free meal along with my girlfriend and was right away greeted by the host staff. They asked if I was a veteran and quickly seated me. The waitress, I forgot her name, was extremely nice and checked on us periodically to see if we needed anything. Overall, GREAT service and would definitely come again.

My husband and I was there last night for the first time and the food was great. We ordered pizza and jambalaya, very tasty! The customer service provided by our waiter and Oscar, which was the manager on duty was excellent. We definitely will revisit.

Came on a Sunday night and it was my boyfriends first time trying CPK. We were told we had about a 5 or 10 minute wait and only had one party in front of us. 20 minutes  and 3 parties seated later (two of which were 2 people like us, and one with 5 people- all came after us), we were sitting in the lobby and the serving staff was trying to convince us to sit on the porch in the wind and cold because they realized they had skipped us and wanted to get us seated. We werent upset because accidents happen and we had come a little earlier than we usually eat so we told them we would wait for a table inside...... and then we were ignored for another 15 minutes while other people were seated or greeted. Get to the table and they are in the middle of a remodel so its dark and disheveled around our table. The waitress tells us the bread is in the oven and will be right over to us... 10 minutes later she takes our drink order and apologizes again that we don't have any bread and says she will be right back... another 10 minutes goes by and she comes back to take our order and remembers that she forgot the bread. She takes the order and then sets off again for the bread, which we never asked for but now that we have been waiting to eat we really are looking forward to.  Drinks get dropped off and then about 15 minutes later our food arrives and our waitress again apologized about not getting the bread for us and she is sorry the food came out first. We were pleasant and never said a word about the service the whole night because we were hungry and just wanted a nice Sunday night dinner date but I couldn't believe how horrible it was. The food was great but I didn't get a refill on my drink until I asked for the check and a box.  The check arrived, the refill arrived but no box. I left the payment, I left a tip for her effort and I left my leftovers on the table. I don't think it was a very good first impression for my boyfriend and I don't think I will be back to CPK for awhile... and probably not this one if I do go.  California Pizza Kitchen is not supposed to be a run of the mill dinner option, it is supposed to be a premium pizza restaurant with outstanding service to match their quality and pricing. I unfortunately had better service at Denny's that morning than I did at CPK. The food was very different quality but I didn't come out of Denny's annoyed.
Nice atmosphere good food. Service is decent. The food is consistently good. For the plaza or is the best high end experience at a reasonable price

Great customer service, the hostess and servers were extremely welcoming, cheerful, and attentive. Our food was so good, my only complaint was that our appetizer chips were so stale but our waiter apologized right away and returned with a new appetizer and it was free. We will be coming back often thanks to the great service and atmosphere.

I love the roasted veggie salad, an awesome vegan option. Doesn't look anything like the picture but it tastes sooooo damn good . Next time I will ask for them to use less oil though, was a little heavy for me. Staff were friendly, and I didn't wait too long for the food. Will be back time and time again!

This is only for take out. Whenever I call to order for pick up they are super friendly.  My food is usually ready in less than 15 minutes.  Also, the girls who handle check out are great!  Always bubbly and remember me by name.  Great service.

Employees at entrance were chatting and didn't greet me. Seated myself at the bar, bartender was great, good appetizers (chicken lettuce wrap) though $34 for two drinks and an appetizer seems ridiculous.

This place is a Joke!!.... I took my wife for a date night and so we decide to go to this place, We wait for about 15-25 minutes and they did't offer us something to drink or anything, so we left. And by they way they were not even busy, we feel very disappointed about this place, this totally ruined our night!!!!! I would never ever recommend this restaurant, the worst place to go.
So far starting out they don't have breadsticks or cheese sticks..... The mac n cheese noodles are really hard and not like pasta.... The pizza wasn't to bad but not worth it's price. Cardboard pizza

The waitress was kind of slow.  She brought us butter but then brought the bread like 15 minutes later.  She brought the food., should have seen  I was low on wine and offered another glass  but didn't for another  15 - 20 minutes later.  Food  was good, service,  so so..

This franchise is one that I am very found of and enjoy to eat or interact with the people in my party at the time. I had a reservation, but I came 10 minutes early. I asked if it was alright, they sat me down right away. Good sign lol . I was really debating on what to get when I ordered but I ended up getting the artichoke dip. It is devine and amazing!!! If i could, it would be the only thing that I would eat as a snack for days!! Although the food was great and all, I found that my service was a bit of the downside. She was polite don't get me wrong. It was just the fact, that some parts she took a while for the beverages. Overall, I am always going to keep coming here obviously lol. The Kicthen Staff is by far my favorite at this location than any other CPK I have dined at.

Came in last night with my boyfriend it was really busy, but it was a Friday night and holidays are here so totally understand. We didn't wait very long, probably about ten min, then got sat at a high top table. Of course booths are more preferable but I enjoyed it. Our waiter was very nice and outgoing. I ordered the avacadoe egg rolls yum! Arrived in a timely manner. Then ordered the Cali club pizza and my bf ordered the penne pasta with shrimp food came pretty fast considering how busy it was. The server past by and could've just said "hey how is everything?" And it could've been perfect , but like I said I totally get the business and there's a lot going on. Overall great experience, good atmosphere, and seemed to be a lot of team work !
Had lunch here today and wanted to give 5 stars to our waitress Heather. Very friendly & great service.

If you like to try many items when eating out, you just might be a fan of CPK's Mini-Cravings menu... lots of little appetizers to dabble in, and they're all pretty tasty. My favorite being the wedge salad - but I know blue cheese fanatics are few and far between these days.  Who says you have to have blue cheese though? There is no rule, you know!  Ask for whatever dressing you like... something tells me the salad will be good regardless. And while we're on the topic of customizing, I get the Kids Mac & Cheese with extra sauce & parmesan cheese shavings on top. Corkscrew noodles are uncommon, but they're perfect for this small, but filling, dish. As for this location, it's more relaxing than other CPK restaurants, clean, and I am so pleased with the entire staff! Bartender, Chefs, and hostess... all genuinely cheerful.  It's what gives this CPK 5 stars.

Today was the first time to visit CPK in a really long time. ...like 20 years.  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food.  Everything we order was delicious and well-prepared.  However, our service from Laura was 10 stars.  She gave us the best service and was personable and fast.  She went way beyond helpful and created a great dining experience.  Also the head chef (sorry, didn't catch his name) was also awesome and extremely professional.  So happy that we went there and will return soon.
I loved the attention and I Loved that they gave us extras. I got their membership card and look forward to making more points

Uh........YUM! I haven't been to a CPK in a minute but let me just say that this last experience has resurrected my love for this place! I had the Chicken Tequila pasta (which was new on the menu) and I also had a mango mango mojito and they were delicious! I've never been so happy eating such a pleasant meal. The trip was well worth it!

Seating was good took a while though to be seated.  Meals were on time cost of on tap beer moderate. Probably best to get a medium to large meal because the smaller portions really aren't that fulfilling. . not much to say kind of convenient because it's there in the plaza. Parking is ok .

My sister and I took our Mom out to lunch for Mother's Day.  She chose California Pizza Kitchen, because it's close to her new condo, and she hadn't tried it yet. I like their cheery, modern decor, and the service was very good.  The food was pretty good too, but my complaint is the prices.  For lunch, on a week day, it was pretty much impossible to find a meal for under $13.  I think that's high, and it's not like they're an up scale restaurant in an up scale local, for goodness sake!  It's Riverside, and there are much nicer places with lunch prices starting at about $9, so next time I would opt for one of those.

This was our second time visiting CPK and our first time was unpleasant but we decided to give it a second chance. BIG MISTAKE!! We both ordered the new  shrimp zucchini scampi which is one of their low calorie options. Before our plates arrived we received cold bread and butter. Then our plates arrived and we realized that we had just spent 30 on a bowl of zucchini with five shrimp. Maybe it was our entree selections but we decided we won't be coming back!!

The waiter is constantly disrespecting me by referring to me as "Bud!" I am old enough to be your father; I bet you don't call him "Bud!" I would tell you his name, but rudely did not introduce himself....
Great taste. Fresh. Salads are bomb.
The new menu is great. Tried the Rib Eye and it was on point. Was helped by Ricky and he was very nice and knowledgable. Would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Hadn't been to a CPK in over ten years? Totally revamped from what I remember. Really enjoy this place their menu suits every taste with veggie and gluten free options.  Service is amazing!! Wine list is pretty nice(for a for a corporate chain) and not overly expensive. Extra plus as a date night favorite because you can buy movie tickets ($8 for theatre across the way) from ur table.

This place looks great after the remodel. Went there tonight (Saturday night) and they played Neil Diamond "Sweet Caroline" over the speaker system and the entire restaurant started singing out loud. Real cool atmosphere. The bartender said they do it sometimes once a day on the weekends, but it was cool. The food was awesome. I got the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza and it was amazing. My wife got white pizza which she loved too. Service was great. Ricky at the bar was polite and very helpful. We will be coming back again for sure.

We went on a Sunday after church, before it got crazy busy,but still took way too long to order, to get drinks and receive our food. It was ok quality but seemed overpriced. Probably won't return anytime soon.
This place is over-rated! The food is good, but not for the prices they charge, and the service and ambiance leaves something to be desired for. With all the other choices out there, I wont be back.
Best customer service that I've had in any of the Riverside Plaza restaurants. The food was great, service was fast, and my drinking glass was always full!
Seems a little over priced for the small plate of spaghetti; and you can get a pizza next door at Blaze for $5 cheaper, HOWEVER the food is good.

My best friend and I are very indecisive people. When we planned to have a dinner date, of course, we couldn`t decide where we wanted to go eat. We tried to think of where we hadn`t gone in a while, and CPK was the first place that we thought of. It wasn`t that busy, but we had to wait a while for a table. Once we got seated, we looked over the menu for a while, and ordered a Chicken Chipotle Pizza and the Pesto Cream Penne to share. They have complimentary bread that they serve, but sometimes you have to ask for it. I`m not a big fan of their bread, but my friend wanted it. I`m more of a hot bread kind of person. It`s so much more satisfying to eat when it`s hot and fresh. CPK`s bread is cold. Not room temperature cold, but taken out of the fridge and let it sit out for a while cold. Bleh... The Chipotle Chicken Pizza is a favorite of mine. It`s THE pizza that I always get when I come to CPK. It has chicken, chilies, and cheese sitting on a spicy sauce with a black bean and corn salsa on top. I can`t take spicy food all that well, so I ask for ranch on the side to cut a little bit of the heat. The Pesto Cream Penne is really good too. I`ve had it once before and I really enjoyed it. It has chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, parmesan cheese, chicken (for an additional charge), and a delicious pesto cream sauce. The last time I had it, the sauce was more green. This time, it took the color of the sun-dried tomatoes. It didn`t really matter because it still tasted yummy.

They are always kind, polite, accurate and assist in finding what you want. We have eaten htere since they opened. The staff go out of there way to be helpful. I am now Gluten - Free and they have an extensive menu for Gluten - Free and Vegans. Great to children and adult alike,.

Came here for a girl's night out dinner. It took about 20 minutes before we were seated which is understandable because the place was full. The hostess was friendly but the servers weren't that great. Our main server tried but it seemed that she was in a bad mood and the vibe she was giving our table was like she didn't want to be there.  Food is is pretty good and the prices are decent. The bread is absolutely delicious but my friend had to ask a server 3 times before we even got any. The restaurant is in a nice place though. The Riverside plaza is a great place to walk around and just get some lunch or something.

I came here because my sister in law just graduated from UC Riverside and this was where she wanted to go for dinner.  First the place is a little hard to find, it's on the backside of the plaza, we had to ask a security guard where exactly it was. My sister in law called ahead and they said they would have a table ready for a group of 10 in 30 minutes, which was about the time it was going to take us to get here. Well the table was not ready and we had to wait another 20-30 minutes after we got there to be sat.  Overall for our group of 10 the service was pretty good, the orders were accurate and the food got out pretty fast. As for the food it was about what you expect from CPK good pizzas with interesting topping combinations.

Came here on a Tuesday for the first time with my boyfriend. I would have never thought of ever trying this place out if it wasn't for the gift card I received. I was expecting a full house but it was pretty empty around 8pm. Service was okay (a bit slow) but staff was friendly.  We ordered a hand tossed California Cobb pizza and some beer. Beers were reasonably prized and pizza came out pretty fast. The pizza was awesome... The dough was good and I even ate the crust! Definitely a must try... I wish it was bigger though for the price it was lol  We will be trying this place again but would rather order to go.

Miso Shrimp Salad (half - $11.79) - light and refreshing.  well-portioned ingredients.  the half size is still a pretty good-sized portion too.  the flavor is nothing too exciting.  3 1/2 out of 5. Wild Mushroom Pizza ($11.99) - decent pizza... not too greasy.  ingredients complement each other well.  3 1/2 out of 5. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine ($12.99) - not too impressed by sauce... too much cream and not very savory.  pasta itself was nicely cooked al dente.  chicken wasn't anything special.  3 out of 5.

I ordered three pizzas.  They were all flavorless.  None of the pizzas had any sauce.  The mushroom pizza had raw mushrooms.  If they had been cooked and seasoned, they would have had flavor.  The chicken garlic pizza had olive oil as the sauce, unseasoned grilled onions, and 8 small chunks of chicken on it.  The Gorgonzola pear pizza had a nice salad on it, but the pizza had very little flavor.  It would have benefited by having some seasoning and perhaps a drizzle of honey for a contrast in favors.  It is sad when I prefer their frozen pizza to their restaurant pizza.

Taste is always great. I ordered the work, pizza. It looked great, but I realized it has barely cheese on it. I asked to put more melt cheese on it and they got me the pizza back which was perfect. And the woman manager came to me and said she will take it out of check. What a nice service!!! My husband and I really enjoyed our weekend dinner here. We defiantly come back again.

The prices are way too much for a one dish pizza. They also lied about happy hour and said that it starts at 6:30 pm and it ends at 6pm. I was not happy at all. Also strike three one of the waitresses was all full of herself. That skinny white girl serving us came to us and asked" what did you say?" after we were discussing our personal business. She is sooo nosy she needs to mind her own business! She seemed like a crack head. We also got around 3 waiters switched off and did not know who was waiting on us.
Drag a frozen pizza in dirt then microwave it. That's the CPK experience. Terrible food, horrible service and over priced.
My chicken ceasar sandwich tasted off.  My pea soup was cold. Friendly service does not make up for bad food. I will not be back.

It's CPK and although California pizza in general is not the most traditional or best representation of the cuisine (the further you get from Italy the more clueless you become), CPK offers a solid option for Californian's interpretation of the medium. Creative toppings trump simplicity and pure love and skill poured into making a crust. On my most recent trip I settled on splitting a grilled veggie salad (I actually think the salads are better than the pizzas here) and a mushroom pizza. We made the call to add red sauce to our pizza and I was impressed of being offered an option of a few different kinds. We opted for the spicy and I have to say the pie turned out pretty good as well. So you kinda get what you expect at CPK, which is of course not really a bad thing.

We've eaten here at least three times in the past couple of years.  The food is usually good, but our most recent visit was not so pleasant.  Our server appeared to be distracted and  couldn't seem to remember that we were in his area.  Water and drink glasses were empty waiting for refills throughout the meal.  The meal for one member of the party was so late, our food was cold by the time it arrived.  The manager figured out that we were not very happy and graciously offered free desserts for the entire party.  That was a nice compromise and the only reason I rated this experience and 3, rather than a 2.   To put things in perspective, the manager gave us about $45 in complimentary desserts on an $80 check....somebody obviously dropped the ball that day.

I love love love this California pizza kitchen . The service is great. The food is also great. I'm a huge fan of the cedar plank Salmon. The roasted veggie salad is so good! I get it with the dressing on the side my friend and I split a half with the salmon and we can hardly finish. If you save room for the deserts. You have to try the new salted caramel it's so good. The drinks are nice and strong as well. I cannot say enough about the food. The staff is great. They really take care of you. I don't like the new menu they did take off some things I wanted to try. But what's left is great. The pasta pizza salads deserts are all on my top list of fav foods. Lol ;-)

Really good. The pizzas are expensive at least to me. "13.59" They do have free bread that I believe that you can constantly get. Only thing is, the bread isn't that soft lol it's kinda hard. CPK is good I just think if i wanted pizza I would go somewhere else. It's good but ain't all that.
Always good pizza. Avocado Club Egg Rolls Chicken Chipotle Pizza is never disappointing. Try a Macaroni and Cheese with Chicken and Broccoli. The service is never bad when we go.

While CPK is good but not the best food, tonight I came just for the Appleberry Sangria and yes, it's still good.  What they lack in food, they make up for in service. Tonight, we sat at the bar and Cyndi was a great server. She was quick on her feet, made sure we were always happy, a fun person to talk to, and even gave us recommendations for where to go next on our bar hopping adventure.

Service:The staff was very attentive .The waitress boxed up my leftovers to go.I was there during lunch time and even though it was busy the manager was walking around and checking on people. Food:I split a Waldorf salad and a white pizza with a friend. The salad was average the pizza was average.No flavors stood out for me.Maybe I will come back to try some different selections.

Overpriced pizza and long wait times. More seating than blaze pizza but to each their own, had the BBQ chicken pizza and felt as though there was 0 cheese on it. Service wasn't bad, waited 45 mins or so to be seated though.

Went for lunch today with coworkers. Their menu prices must have gone up to pay for the remodel. I ordered a full size Thai crunch salad, thinking I could eat the other half later. Our server asked if I wanted avocado, and I said yes. I didn't pay attention to the price in the menu. I only drank water. I got my bill: $17.74.  .gosh. Really?? I checked with another coworker who also got a full-size salad. Same price. Wow. It's just a salad!! I remember paying $13 in the past and thinking THAT was a lot. It was a good salad but not worth $22 with tip. If we have to go here again I'll stick with one of their small plates and call it a day...yikes.
Excellent food and service! A training facility and it shows! Friendly hostess, servers and management! Great selection of food that is professionally prepared! I fine here 3-4 times per week!

I was at California Pizza Kitchen for lunch the other day.  I always get my usual Chicken Tequila Fettuccini (YUM) but wanted to try something different.  While I was struggling with my decision, I was told if I don't like what I ordered they would replace it at no cost.  Yay!  That is great customer service =)

Had the sausage poblano pizza flatbread, mushroom spinach flatbread pizza and a house salad. House salad was, well, house salad. Mushroom and spinach pizza was decent and the sausage poblano had a good taste, but was a bit dry. Next time I'll stuck with what I know at CPK.

Let me start off by saying, if nothing else, the staff here are pretty friendly and accommodating.  Waiter was jovial, and hostess didn't mind moving us from a drafty table next to a door. However, good service can't make up for bland food. Best dish of the night was the miso shrimp salad. Generous portions of shrimp, a light dressing, and crispy wonton strips made for a surprisingly good salad. The two other items I tried were simply "meh." The Jambalaya pasta was decent and had a nice spicy kick to it, but was actually pretty one note. Not terrible, just not outstanding. The pesto chicken pizza was just extremely dry. Flavors were actually okay, but the pizza was a bit of an effort to eat and I had to wash each bite down with some Pepsi. In terms of CPK, this one is a good one to go to due to good service, but CPK food will remain CPK food.

Very "pricey" place. Would only come to eat here if with a CPK gift card. BOO Our server was okay. The set up is nice. The appetizers and main foods were served in small portions. (Unless, I must be eating too much.) Anyway, the food we ordered was delicious. I enjoyed the thin crust roasted artichoke and spinach pizza!! Yum Would I come back? As I have said, only if with a CPK gift card.

Just walked out after waiting at the bar for about 10 minutes without being acknowledged. When I ordered a draught beer I was told the glasses just came out of the dishwasher and were hot. I told the server I would wait but go ahead and place my food order she walked away and thought she would return to take my order but went to take care of other customers, I will not be back due to very poor customer service,

Past visits haven't been all that, but last night's return here made for an excellent dinner. The interior is rather chic with an illuminated bar and friendly servers, and my particular waiter was both helpful and knowledgeable. When I asked for a crisp Pinot Grigio, he suggested an excellent Estancia, which was exactly what I was hoping for.  Having won me over with wine, I asked his recommendation on pizza, and ended up getting the Carnitas Habanero, which was tender and tasty but hot! I could barely use half a spoonful on each slice without needing copious refills on my water glass. For dessert, we had the lemon cake which surprised me by being tasty but not overpowering. I'm wary of overly sweet frosting, but this cake was just the right balance of sweet and fluffy. I was impressed by last night's service and I'll see about making another visit to judge if the overall quality of the place has improved, or if I just got lucky.

CPK Must-haves: Jamaican Jerk Pizza [B] Skip: Looking at the calories If you are looking for a very high calorie mediocre meal, try CPK. While the flavor is there, the chef's at CPK have not found a way to keep the calories down.  For example: I used to like the Thai Chicken Salad until I found out it had 2440 calories in it. Food: C- | Service: D+ | Selection: C | Experience: D | Overall: D+

Worst service I have ever had at any restaurant! Sat down at 7pm and didn't get our food until 8:20pm, my daughter described her pizza as burnt bread. I didn't eat my pizza since I've received better food at cafeterias. Sadly, this was supposed to be a night to celebrate my wife and it turned out to be a disaster. Do not go here!

The California egg rolls are good. The club bread is a little to hard although it tasted good I had to be carefull not to to year my mouth up. Their pizzas are pretty good and the diet soda w/ cherry was missted well. They stopped brining you bread unless ask I guess, but the bread and butter are cold so not that big of loss. They turned up the music really loud to overcome the people talking although it didn't very crowded it was on the loud side and we were close to the hostess station where there were 5 people talking about personal stuff I'll pretty loud (so see if you can sit further away from there if you want it quieter . the server was nice but it probably will be a little while before we come back.

While the food and atmosphere were both great, the service was horrid! After serving us our pizzas, our server (Kimberly) completely forgot about us. She never cleared our appetizer dishes, never refilled our empty drinks, never checked to see how everything was, never stopped by to box up our leftovers (after we had clearly been done for some time) and never brought by our check. She disappeared for so long, in fact, that we finally had to ask our hostess to box up our food and get our check. That took another 25 minutes! While there was a manager around, she was oblivious to the fact that we were completely ignored and obviously upset. I go to a lot of CPKs around Southern California but the service here has always been the worst. We gave them another shot and they failed miserably!
Service was too slow. The pizzas we ordered were good but the pasta dishes were slightly undercooked.

Came in here recently with my daughter because she likes to sit up at the bar and watch her pizza being made. This is not my type of restaurant but it was her day, so I let the little lady pick. First of all we sat at the bar for about 5 minutes after the guy said he, "Would be right with us". I asked him if he had a kids menu and some crayons and he said sure he would get some. Another five minutes later he came back to get our drink orders. Kids menu? Nowhere to be seen. I was not eating so I just ordered a drink and ordered her a Sprite. Five minutes later we ordered, still with no kids menu. Pepperoni and cheese pizza came out without pepperoni and when I told him I had ordered pepperoni, he proceeded to walk over in front of me and check his order on the screen. Are you frigging kidding me. No apologies he just told me he had put in cheese and took the pizza and told them to put pepperoni on it. Our drinks were never refilled. He never checked on us and I used bar napkins to wipe my child's face. An extremely crappy dining experience even for a CPK.
love their avacado egg rolls.... could eat those all day long!

Showed up at about 12:30pm and put our name in at the seating desk and were told it would be about ten minutes.  I stood no more than five feet from the desk since it was going to be a short wait.  Time kept ticking by and we are seeing many empty tables but no one is being seated except for a large party of seven who they went all out to find when their tables were ready.  They even went outside looking for them.  Two other couples came in just after us and were doing the same wait.  Finally after 30 minutes I took the two short steps to the desk and asked how much longer.  The lady at the desk said she had called my name twice and was in the process of crossing us off the list.  I asked if she was using a PA/paging system or just shouting out names thinking that maybe their PA was malfunctioning.  She said she was just shouting out names.  Funny, none of the other waiting customers heard her call any names either (Yes, I asked them).  I was standing directly in front of her less than five feet away.  So this is a pretty big hole to recover from and things were much better after we were seated but nothing special.  The food was OK and the wait staff was very attentive but the first impression was terrible.

This establishment lost my business years ago.  I took my friend there to celebrate his 21st birthday. The waiter took 15 minutes from the time we were seated to come by the table. He didn't apologize for the wait, asked us what we wanted to drink, then took another 10 minutes to get us our drinks. I was trying to be nice and figured he was busy, but it took another chunk of time to bring us our food, which was half cold. He never came back to check on us. The only thing he was quick about was bringing us the tab.  I don't tip for lousy service, so he decided to tip himself 10 dollars on a 20 dollar meal. I spoke  to the manager the following day  about the situation and he started giving me BS excuses about the service and 50% tip. Only way I got my money back was through my bank. To recap. Go to this joint if you want lousy service bringing you half cold mediocore food and if you want to get ripped off.

Honestly? It doesn't live up to the hype. Sure, their pizzas are good, especially that thin-and-crispy crust, but you know what, I'm a toppings kind of guy. I'd much rather go to BJ's and get a deep-dish Pizza like the ones they serve. I had The Works, it was good -  the vegetables were fresh and the flavor stood well, however, the meat left me looking for something that wasn't there.  Also, what's up with their Parmesan Cheese and Pepper Shakers? The cheese likes to clump in the shaker, and the pepper... it just doesn't want to come out at all!

You gotta give more credit to this CPK! Its centrally located in Riverside plaza, across from the Borders and theater herhe. The place has really nice decor and its always clean. The best places to sit is probably outside on their patio. The servers are always nice and pizzas are pretty fresh. I love the cajun chicken pizza, it really blows my mind. Also try the spinach artichoke dip, probably one of the freshest and delicious dips I've tried ever. Love their mojitos and other drinks here!

came in before watching Iron Man 2, it wasn't very busy but it was also a monday night. We were seated right away and our server Lutie greeted us and took our drink order, she was very nice. I started off with a spinach cheese dip and a caesar salad...the dip is delicious as always, I love theirs. I was wondering at first why a half order of caesar costs almost 7.00 dollars and then it came out...huge salad with lots of big parmesan shavings it looked like peeled human skin...lol. My boyfriend and I shared a chipotle pizza , a pizza with chipotle sauce, chipotle chicken , corn, onions etc, We were really excited for it but then tasted just spicy blandness ...i had to ask for ranch to dip it in just so it would have flavor. we will try a different pizza next time. all together the dip, salad, pizza and one dirty martini cost $38.00

CPK it's the standby for seeing a movie and grabbing a quick bite. We always seem to eat the same things, and the quality is always the same. We start out by ordering the tricolour salad pizza, mixed field greens tossed on top of an extra thin crust pizza. It's almost like a salad on a cracker. The crust has parmesan cheese baked into it.  Our next order is the wild mushroom pizza (thin crust) with a couple of ice tea's.  Previously when seated at CPK they served you bread and butter, no longer you've got to ask for it. I guess since I'm ordering pizza I don't need the bread. But I remember water rationing at restaurants, now bread rationing, whats next utensils. I don't want to have to eat everything with my fingers.
koatzin is an awesome waiter!!!!!!!!! great food, nice atmosphere, fun time!
Love the Vegetarian Greek Pizza. Wish they still had the roasted pepper and goat cheese

Food is definitely overpriced and more often than not the service just isn't great.  My granddaughter loves to go here for an individual pizza WHEN WE GO TO THE MOVIES, right across the mall sidewalk.  If it weren't for that (and gift cards) I wouldn't make the drive to eat here.

What happened to CPK Riverside? It used to be soooo good! Our service was great, but the food was no good. The usually delicious spinach artichoke dip was luke warm and the chips were stale. I tried something new- Chicken Tequila Fetticune. It was just okay. My husband had the California Club Sandwich on chibatta bread. Don't get it unless you really like hard crumbly bread. My son's pepperoni pizza was good as usual. The restaurant was not busy on a Sunday evening. Now I know why.

The last time I came here (about 2 weeks ago?). I got a pretty nice server, she was super friendly, helped us out with our meal selections, and was really on top of her game in making sure everything was ok for us. I got the chicken lettuce wraps, which were pretty good but not as good as the Yardhouse wraps. My friend got the Habanero Pizza which I do warn you, it is spicy! Overall the good and service was good, oh and the wait was about 10 minutes. I'd come back.

Came for Friday night dinner with family. Busy night but no wait for a table for 4.  Had a small plate Bianco flatbread which was hot and tasty and came very quickly. Ordered 3 pizzas:Sicilian, the Works, and a thin crust Margherita. All tasty and we had leftovers too. Seemed well staffed tonight with excellent service.  Extra bread, water refills,  manager stop at our table,  everyone in restaurant seemed happy tonite. No problem using CPK member promotions. Very nice dinner with family.

CPK.......CPK...... ;) Well it was a Friday evening.. Movies at the house, let get some grub, how about Pizza!!! But not the same old same old, let's change it up, How about, California Pizza Kitchen!!! Let's try it out... ;) Went online to check out the Menu.. tons of choices ;) I like.  When it came down to the final phone call, we placed a order for two Pizzas and Dessert; The Meat Cravers;  A combination of sweet Italian sausage, pepperoni, Canadian bacon, Capicola ham, julienne salami, Mozzarella cheese and our tomato sauce was the first. And my favorite the Original BBQ Chicken and two slices of Red Velvet cake... Cost was 43 bucks and wait time for pick-up was 20-25 mins...  Well Worth it!!! ;) Both pizzas were cooked with care ;) and the cake was perfect so yummy ;P Trust; even after the car ride the food was true and GREAT!!!  Two Thumbs Up on this..... A nice chill night  with some good take out ;)  5+ in my book

What recession?! CPK was packed to capacity on a Friday night! Pass the wait time by shopping in nearby stores; the buzzer thingy works throughout Borders and down past the movie theatres!  After picking up Gordon Ramsay's Fast Food and Anne Rice's Blood Canticle and Merrick, I got a little too excited when I felt the vibe go off in my pocket. I was ravenous! Restaurant chains are great for prompt service, edible food, and reasonable prices. This was no exception. Asparagus soup - Decent.  Grilled Chicken Sandwich on Garlic Cheese Foccacia - Bland and tasteless, needs green chile sauce! Sonora Eggrolls - Also needs more green chile sauce! Supreme Pizza - Pizza Hut would be proud. $42 (including tax/tip) for two. Although I think I'd still prefer Pizza Hut.

i've always been a fan of CPK.. i haven't eaten there in years. since i had a gift card, i took my sis there to grub..  the server was really rude in a way, i mean he was attentive but always slammed our drinks on the counter (we sat at the bar) and plates were just kind thrown in our face. i tried not to mind him. anyways, the food was good as i remember, jerk pizza and oriental chicken salad. we killed all of it and left a small tip.  next time server guy, be a little nicer..

I will NEVER EVER go there again. I can't believe the absolute poor service that me and my significant other received. About a month ago we went to CPK being in the mood for some pizza. The hostess took us to our table and was very kind and friendly. When our waiter finally arrived. There were way too many mistakes or should I say - excessive rude treatment.? First, he did not give us plates, nor napkins, nor utensils for our appetizers. (We let that one go) Second, when we finally received our order he did not give us plates (again) nor any parmesan cheese and pepper. (My boyfriend had to bother and ask to receive all this "standard" stuff.) *He mentioned that he was getting trained to work on the bar, and that's why he was not completely there.* Third, he NEVER bothered to ask us if we wanted any refills or anything else. Fourth, at some point at the end of our dinner some other waitress (whom was not our server by the way) came to our table and without asking if we wanted refills just gave us refills. Made me think, is this lady deaf? Can't she ASK us if we want any before she barges in our business? She never bothered to say a word. (Did I mention it was at the end of our dinner? It's too f-ing late lady, I volutarily produced more saliva to get my pizza to go down!) Fifth and last, the worse out of our terrible experience in this CPK was the long a## wait for the check. Our waiter took too long to give us our check. He CLEARLY ignored us... And he ALSO didn't give us a pen. We waited longer to get him to pay attention to us for a pen. He NEVER apologized for anything. I'm assuming it's normal and okay to treat customers in that form. If you're wondering if we tipped this poor level waiter, the answer is "hell no"! All he should ever receive is my spit on a napkin with the written phrase "F### Y##". I don't give a rat's ass if he was getting trained to work in the bar, there is NO EXCUSE to miss on standard stuff like "plates, untensils, napkins, parmesan cheese and pepper, refills, and a damn PEN!" - what did he expect us to write with, our blood? I repeat, I will NEVER EVER go there again.

What can I say about this establishment?  The service was great, the food was even better, and to top it off our hostess and waitress were the most down to earth people you could ever meet.  I remember our waitresses, Annette was the most charismatic, charming, and funny person you will run into at this establishment! If you don't get her as your waitress, make a special request for her, I guarantee you will not regret it.  That woman is on her job! She made everything flow so perfect. REQUEST ANNETTE OR YOU MIGHT REGRET!!!
Food is so-so here. Food is nothing to write home about. Before going across the street to the movies, this place will do in a pinch. Service is fair.

CPK has some of the friendliest wait staff ever. Came in for extra credit as part of a class from UCR and our waitress was friendly about doing separate checks for our party of 6. They make sure to serve you with a smile and are attentive when it comes to making your orders and refilling your drinks. The pizza is overrall awesome as a more personal and authentic cooking of a pizza.

Use to like getting pizza at this place...but after tonight, maybe not anymore. I don't like the new crust at all or the new way they're putting toppings on the pizza. The crust was floppy, thin, and tough. The toppings were scattered unevenly on the pizza. I didn't order the thin crust pizza either. I guess I'll just stick to the pastas and appetizers.
Omfg! I hate CPK the food was cold and the service was lousy. The staff was very slow in getting our food.

My boyfriend and I recently moved to Riverside so a quick and convenient meal has been helpful while we get settled. Our first two nights in town (3/6 & 3/7) we ordered online for curbside pick-up. Very easy and simple process, the food is good (which is to be expected when ordering or dining out anywhere). Despite 'pizza' being in their name, lots of variety on the menu, which is nice, especially when you aren't sure what you are in the mood for. The gentleman that was our curbside "server" both nights was great! Very nice, and made sure we had everything we needed. Wish we got his name. Even though it was a brief interaction, his customer service was on point. The customer service brings what would have been a 4 star review to a 5 star.

SO SALTY! Never been to CPK decided to give it a go.   Oh man not a good choice. The pizza was so freakin' salty!   I was still thirsty the morning after. Ordered 2 pizzas-artichoke+spinach and the supreme I really don't get the hype about this place and coming from ATX there are way BETTER places (local) than this mega chain sellout.

Two of us ate here this time.  The food was great. The service was superior.  Desserts were great.  Drinks were fine.  Price has become reasonable and they now have a smaller appetite menu that's great and right on the money. They also have provided more bread with the humus and you can order extra for $1. Plus, the place is spotless, including the restrooms.   The reason for 3 stars instead of 4 or 5 is that they have not gotten with the idea of putting calories next to each item. I think this is becoming critical in this day and age.

Me and my colleagues went to this CPK establishment after school(late afternoon). The hostess sat us in a near the front which was nice however put us in the middle of two sets of customers  when there was clearly more than enough empty seats in this part of the restaurant. The waitress was quick with the ordering and very nice and kind and attentive to what we wanted. However it took some time more than me am my colleagues would have liked to receive our food when I saw people who had gotten here some time after we had arrived gotten there food much quicker. The waitress wasn't pushing dessert down our throats like most establishments which I found refreshing. Although maintenance had begun vacuuming around us which I found could have waited being there a many of people and found it somewhat rude. The food was nothing spectacular however was CPK standards. However an overall good experience.

Japanese Eggplant vegetarian pizza:  has a bunch of veges and giant peices of broccoli on top. Had it with the thin crust pizza. It tasted really yummy! Garlic Fettuccine pasta: Super garlicy and creamy! This was my favorite of the night! We order two other dishes, but i forgot the name of it. One was another Fettuccine pasta and the other was a small side of Quesadilla. Both tasted good.  Price wise, everything was super expensive, but i was already expecting that when coming here to CPK, Their portions seemed super small. Each pasta looked like it serves only 1 person.  Service here was great though. Our waitress was nice and attentive. She came over to check on us twice. Dont come too late though, there might be a long wait. I came at around 5:30 and we had to wait around 15 min.
Pizzas ok, service is good Beers on tap = makes things better it took a while for the food to come out, but other than that, no complaints.

Had a really lovely meal there on Mother's Day. It actually had a reservation at Mazz across the street however was told we had to wait well over an hour in 108° heat; thank goodness we were able to get into California pizza kitchen with a short wait. My mother enjoyed all of her food the staff is very friendly, one our waiter, Juan,  was very attentive. Especially considering how Busy the restaurant was.  Good variety of dishes, great soups and vegetarian options, overall a very positive experience.  Thank you California pizza kitchen for saving my 80-year-old mother's Mother's Day celebration!

Of all the CPKs that I've been to, I have always had great food and service at the Riverside location. Love both the Roasted Veggie Salad with Salmon and the Caramelized Peach and Spinach salad with salmon. Free wifi was a bonus.

YUM. I love it here. Any of their pizzas are amazing. I usually just get a basic tomato basil pizza and it is deeelicious. Also, they have an awesome cobb salad here AND you can add in my favorite food, beets! They have a great wine selection and any drink you could ever want. For dessert, get the red velvet cake. You'll just about die and go to heaven.
food was good..portions are kind of small but the food is good and they have hangar24 on tap so thats cool

I have had the five cheese + fresh tomato pizza. It was good, but it could be better considering the price for it. Service was good too despite it being busy (friday night), but eh I'd rather go somewhere else or maybe I should try something else on their menu lol. The price makes me want to stay away.

This is a nice place, good food, reasonable prices.  Menu is well designed and it's always easy for everyone to find something to order, including kids. This is one of my favorite things about CPK.  Roasted veggie salad is excellent. Also had two pizzas, chocolate soufflé cake, and drinks. Liked the mango lemonade.  Efficient server.
Thai Crunch Salad & Jambalaya are my favorites.  However, food takes forever! as in forever! So now, I just order food to go since they can actually make it in 15 - 20 mins.

Went for dinner on a Saturday Night, late - probably around 9:15. Our server was Cyndi, probably one of the best servers I have ever had. She was genuinely friendly and happy which was great. I even offered her a job I was so impressed. On to the food: Pizza was cold and blah, sad for a place who's name contains pizza! Had a Mohito that was also blah and lacking the "ness". Doubt I will be coming back, not because I was somehow overly offended or let down, but simply because I feel no desire to, no value in doing so I guess. BJ's does everything CPK does, but far better.

Had some bomb chicken picatta here the other day. Everything else is straight up mediocre and really feels like a chain nowadays. We started going here to change things up and to revisit what we otherwise thought was a joke of a chain. It's nothing different.. I think we just ordered better stuff this time. Go here for those days when you're like.. whatever dude.

Had the pleasure of visiting CPK this past friday before seeing a movie. I had the chimmichurri chicken with veggies (550 cals :) ) - It was very very yummy!!! Also our waitress was amazingly polite and seemed busy but still managed to give us the attn expected without "hovering". Definitely would visit again!
Amazingly packed at 5:30 on a Friday: forty five minute wait for a party of two. Beware the massive crowds. I ended up elsewhere but will return again soon to review food and service.

I really cant complain about this CPK, the service is incredibly fast, they had all our food and drinks out within minutes considering how busy it was. The new fried mac n cheese balls are amazing and so is the chicken tequila pasta. Definitely recommend this one to all my friends its nice a big so there's always a spot and no wait.

As a pharmaceutical representative in the Riverside area and having spent many thousands of dollars here on large catering orders, I was very dissapointed by my experience here with take-out today.  There was a mix-up for a catering order that I had to pick up and deliver to the other side of Riverside.  I had to go back to pick up the part of the order that got left off.  When I got back to the restaurant, I was informed by the manager that he and his staff did not make the mistake and the order was not placed correctly.  I told him that regardless I need to fix it with the office I delieverd to and wanted the remainder of my order.  He told me I was going to have to pay for it because it was the office who took the order's mistake and not his. This explaining of how he was not at fault went on for several minutes as my customers are waiting for their food.   When I told him that it is not okay for me to have two charges for the same event for expense purposes and that I do tons of business with his restaurant on a weekly basis anyway, the manager told me that he has tons of business anyway and it doesn't matter to him if he loses mine.   It is very sad that a company who prides itself on customer service would hire such an incompetant and highly rude individual to be a manager.  Pharmaceutical reps make up a large majority of the lunchtime business in that particular location, and I will do my best to make sure that every rep and doctor's office in the area hears about this incident and the condescending nature of its manager.  I will never support that location again.

Italian Deli Sandwich - Try it with the onion-herb bread.  The combination of bread/meats/spread is about the best sub sandwich I've ever had.  I enjoy many items on this menu, but it will take awhile before I order anything else. Service is spotty - hopefully you will get someone who cares and is not distraced by the cell phone in their pocket or what time they get off.
Good location.  Good food.  Good chain.  Try their special appetizers, a couple of those will make up a good meal.

Gluten Free - CPK has updated their gluten free menu and their food handling process. My daughter enjoyed their BBQ Chicken pizza last night and I must say it is one of the best tasting GF crusts we have had!  The manager came to the table and asked questions about her allergy. Then he assured us he would watch the preparation of her meal from start to finish! I didn't request this mind you, this is their new process!  It does take a little longer but is worth the wait knowing you won't get sick! I also like their flavored teas.

Our local hangout..always have our seat at the bar & know many couple's there & enjoy the great drinks..PLUS..the friendly bartenders!  We have alot of fun! Cobb salad & the barbque chicken salad is the bomb..order it weekly!   Mai Tai's...Long Island Ice tea's...STRONG!

I've experienced a lot better Pizza. The CPK around here has a long wait time, upwards of half an hour, for food that tastes like it should have come out of a school cafeteria. They have a wide variety of Pizza to choose from. I got one that had large avocado slices for toppings. But no matter what they put on top of the underwhelming pizza, it's the same underwhelming experience.  The restaurant has a very classy atmosphere, and you can bring a big group here for a good time and some drinks. But if you are going out for a good pizza, I suggest elsewhere.

The service at this location was much better than other CPKs I have been to. Waitress was friendly and refilled drinks promptly. Manager even came by to make sure everything was ok. Food was very good -- enjoyed the chicken club sandwich and the tortilla soup. I'll definitely go back for the soup, especially on cold days.
Nothing special here. The service was just ok along with the food. I would eat here again if someone else wanted to but I wouldn't choose to go here.

No complaints here. The server that seats us has always been friendly, along with the waiter or waitress. Food never took long to get to our table, drinks were always refilled, and I love their tiramisu. =o)

thought i give this place a try, never been here before. I probably wont go there again, the food was overpriced for what they serve you. The waitress made it known that she was tired, and you can tell she did not want to be there. she was  still very nice , but i get that its a friday night and you dont want to work but dont tell everybodt we dont care. any ways i ordered the scallop noodle dish, not going to lie it was pretty good, but not for  $14!!! It wasent even busy in there, and i did not get  asked once if i wanted some more pepsi.I  even asked for hot sauce and they never brought it to me , untill i asked another waiter. I was better off a cheesecake factory for the price of the noodle dish. i also felt lke i was being rushed out of there because we had at least 2 people come to our table telling us which door to use  when we  were ready leave. Every one talks  soo highly of this place and i did not see what all the hype was aabout.
I had the Chinese Chicken salad. Loved it. Service was good, although not perfect, the kindness and hospitality was a pleasant change from some places. I would go again if I were in the area.

The CPK here is wonderful BECAUSE the waiters/waitress are actually friendly and they actually care about your needs. The raspberry lemonade is also the best sweet drink around.  My boyfriend usually gets the tortilla soup which I always help myself to but this time around I ordered my own and was less then happy about it.  The soup unlike at other places was unusually sour and there were hardly any tortilla pieces.  Next the chips for the artichoke dip were actually stale but nevertheless the almost perfect artichoke spinach dip saved the appetizer.  I ended up ordering a chicken sandwitch but if you're like me and you don't appreciate too much flavor you may want to ask them to go easy on the mustard, I forgot and it was so extreme I had to eat sans one side of bread.  However the food is usually awesome and the place and workers are great sooo... 4stars!!!
