We ordered the stuffed pizza with sausage, pepperoni, and mushrooms. The bottom and edge of the pizza was crispy, just the way I like it. It didn't have a lot of sauce on/in it but was still pretty flavorful. In the end though, I remember that  I enjoyed the stuffed pizza at Sbarro better.  Make sure you don't go starving because the wait for the fresh baked stuffed pizza is quite long.

This place is pretty much the same as any CPK elsewhere. This is a great place to go to if you want healthy pizzas with a gormet touch. I tried their new pizza and it wasn't that good. If your new, try the original bbq pizza because you can't fail with that one. Good waiter service, it was pretty empty at lunch but had a very casual atmosphere. Each pizza was about 12 dollars, i suggest everyone gets a pizza and just share it so you get more variety. Eating a whole pizza of the same toppings gets a bit dry.

I ate here and shared a couple of pizzas which I thought were terrible! The crust, sauce and toppings remind me of cafeteria pizza. I was very surpirsed, because by the crowd it seemed like a popular place. Nonetheless, when are large group of friends picked this as a dinner spot, I gave it another try (and commited to avoiding the pizza). I had the Spinach dip appetizer, which I thought was cheesy and delicious, and the caesar chicken sandwich, which was also pretty good. It's nice that they have a full bar for drinks with dinner (seemed kinda crazy about IDing).

My bestie demanded we meet up here so I caved and we met up. I ordered the pear & gorgonzola pizza. Yum am I happy I did! Only frustration was with our cocktails.  The girls ordered mojito's. After a couple sips , they had a full glass if ice. Management came over to explain that it was a shot of tequila and a little bit of mix. I highly recommend if you plan on ordering cocktails here... SAY EASY ICE! the manager did give her a makeup mojito.  So we left happy... better experience on this visit.
This was my first time at CPK and it was so delicious. The customer service was fantastic and the manager was so friendly! Definitely will be back soon!

This was my first time in a cpk restaurant and the service was great! We tried one of the newer menu items (flatbread with the white sauce) and it was delicious. Since I was celebrating the end of summer school, I definitely had to get a drink. The sangria I ordered was perfectly balanced between sweet and bitter and the added fruit was nice too. I ended up getting a lunch special and then a chocolate cake for dessert. Overall, it was a great dining experience.
Is it just me or is their fork not the right size?   Anyway, pad your lunch just in case.  I am not sure if that's a norm but anticipate a wee longer in food delivery.

Lunch on a Thursday and CPK was quite busy. No booths for at least 15 to 20 minutes, so my client and I settled for a table. Our server Brooke took our drink order asap and I enjoyed a regular flavored lemonade. My entree order - Shrimp scampi with zucchini and pasta. Taste was good and the portion was just right. My client went with the Hawaiian pizza and a beer which he must have enjoyed BC he inhaled the entire pizza. Overall a pleasant lunch and yes I secured an upcoming project worth $180K

First, the servers are really nice. I think my waitress was Ashley. Our group stalled a lot and had lots of demands but she was very nice and gave us excellent service throughout. I love pizza. Perhaps CPK's pizza is not my style(?).  The crust is not my favorite choice... I ordered the wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil. I love truffle oil and mushroom and the addition of shallots sounded so good. Nope. It was so bland, and the truffle oil is just placed on the side. Very disappointing.... To be honest, I think I would have been more satisfied with Costco or little ceasars. I am not sure if I would be coming back here... Paid $15 for poor pizza. Even the free bread and oil was bland. i wish they had more seasoning in the oil. It just seemed to me like just plain olive oil. However, the brownie sundae was really good. brownie filled with chocolate chips with Haagen dazs ice cream on top and only 2! If possible, get the kids size. The kids size was perfect to even split in 4-ways.  Overall, good service but poor flavor.
Awesome service here! Although I'm disappointed that cpk discontinued the shrimp scampi pizza, I still love the food and the service especially at this location. :)

Food is great and inexpensive but the last couple of times I've been here the silverware and platters had tiny pieces of baked in food particles. The first time I complained to the manager. They need to invest in a better dishwasher and or start retraining the dishwashing staff.

I hate how loud this place is!!! The kitchen is fully open, which makes the restaurant loud and then everyone there talks louder to hear each other over the kitchen.  This is not our go to place (it's actually pretty low on our list of restaurants we like), but when my husband has a craving for the Jamaican Jerk pizza, we come here.  My husband says the Jamaican Jerk pizza is amazing, but order it on the regular crust, the thin can't hold all the goodness.  I'm not a fancy pizza person, I don't see the hype in CPK's pizza, to me it's just ok, I'd rather get papa johns. I was told of you get one of their speciality pizzas, they are great.   I've tried a couple of CPK's pasta dishes, they are good, not the best, but good.  Over all the food is fine, the drinks are good,  the service is friendly and fast. I gave CPK 3 stars just bc it's so loud in the there every single time I come here!!! Next time I am sitting outside.
This is one of the most best pizza place I have ever been to I enjoy all their food salad is amazing customer I come here all the time has really great prices thank you for your services
First time going lastnight was not disappointed. We sat at the bar,the staff was nice and the food was really good.I loved the bianco (I think that was the name) bread which was free for signing up.

We sat at the bar tonight. The bartender was awesome! She was right on point, and right on time.  CPK is the same all over. Normally they get 3-4 stars on food and experience. It was our service that kicked it up.  Thanks, Cyndi. You made our night here great.

our server was awesome. very nice paid attention to us a lot and overall i had a great time. treated us with respect. but he was a very enthusiastic food server. i forgot his name but he was short lol
CPK is good but so expensive D:  Try the penne cream pasta or the chicken tequila is also my favorite.

I love CPKs food. Especially the pasta, it's amazing! The service is usually decent and sometimes ehh on busy nights, which is a little understandable. But today I had my worst CPK experience.  I went in Thanksgiving Friday noon and was greeted by a nice young lady who told me about the new rewards card system. Which was nice because I eat at CPK quite often. Sat down, our server, Ricky took my order, and everything went as usual.  I asked Ricky for a basket of bread. After waiting for a while, I felt like he forgot. So I tried to catch someone's attention to remind him. But everyone would just pass by me like they didn't  see or hear me. And they wasn't busy at all. A server named Kim was just standing in front of the bar chatting away, right in front of me. And when her eyes met mines and she saw my hand she just tried to look away. she walked by my table and I said "excuse me!" She just rolled her eyes high and pretended not to hear or see me.  I understand the whole "it's not my table thing." But come on.. Your here getting paid and if your not busy is it really hard to just grab my server. She just posted leaning on the bar table with another lady who I couldn't see the name tag but and chatted. It was soo hard just to get anything I needed. My server was more concentrated on his bar duties than us. And he seemed almost annoyed to serve us. And trust me we weren't needy. All we wanted was a basket of bread before our meal and butter. Refill of water. Check and to go box. We spent more time trying to get someone to help us than eat. But there was a server named Maggie, she was amazing. Even though she was holding plates in her hands and she wasn't or server, she took the time to stop and ask what we needed. And she helped is every time. I almost felt bad that it was only her picking up everyone's slack. Well over all I'm super disappointed in CPKs service staff. I would have expected them to be more professional and less self serving.

Used to come here all the time for their Carne Asada pizza that just was too delicious and seemed to be the only place around that did it exactly how we liked it. Well, unfortunately the ONLY item we ever came to this place for ended up being cancelled.  No more carne asada pizza. We asked the waiter why and he said it was because it took too long to make. It was worth the wait in our opinion and since then we have not been back after giving the other pizzas a shot... They just can't compare to the Carne Asada and its green sauce. As far as service and everything else goes, we always were attended correctly and on a timely manner. We never had any problems with the food, the seating and atmosphere is also very nice, calm and relaxing.  I don't know if it was just this CPK that 86'd their carne asada pizza or if it was a franchise wide decision... Either way, we really wish it would make a come back!

Great food, superior service, vegetarian & gluten free options! I'm not a huge pizza fan which is probably why I hadn't really been to CPK much.  But after moving a buddy of mine suggested we meet there.  I agreed and I'm so glad I did!  I guess I shouldn't have assumed that pizza was all they had, but it is in the name and all. Since then I've been there more times than I could count and I can honestly say that it's always been a very positive experience.  One time I went there with my sister (who orders from the Gluten Free Menu) and they went so far out of their way to make sure we were taken care of.  After making the wrong pizza, they took it off the bill and had the chef come out to apologize.  So incredibly nice!!!   They have plenty of vegetarian options, but my favorites are the Aspargus & Argula salad, white corn guacamole and the tortilla soup, simply delicious! Great food, superior service and resonably priced keeps CPK at the top of the list of places I consider when heading out to eat...
Came in for lunch, food was as always so good!!! Great service and very friendly atmosphere!
This was our first visit, the food was good, our service was just ok. The ladies room was really dirty, I am not sure if that is typical or a fluke.

Disappointing and painfully slow. My daughter and I wanted to enjoy a later lunch on a lovely Sunday afternoon. CPK seemed to be a good choice.  The place was not busy and we got seated right away. Unfortunately, it took 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us at all. I had to call a server over to let them know we had been waiting. After getting water from the server I beckoned, a different server came over to get our drink order. It was still another 5-7 minutes before our server ever came over. She apologized for the wait, and took our order. I finally got the beer I ordered initially some 5-10  minutes later. But that was not the end of the painfully slow ordeal. It must have taken another 15 minutes before we got a salad to our table.  Finally our pizza order arrived, some 40 minutes after we were seated. After we ate, I asked our server why the service was so slow and why it took so long for us to get food. She apologized, said it was her mistake for not noticing us, and offered us a free desert. THEN SHE DISAPPEARED FOR ANOTHER 15 MINUTES!!! Once again, making us wait. By the time she returned, I was so exasperated, that all I wanted was the check. This type of service is completely unacceptable, with all the competition out there, we will definitely be taking our business elsewhere.

Came here on business travel and hadn't eaten all day.  I came in with the idea I would have a lighter meal like a salad.  That didn't happen.  I ended up having the short ribs and a sangria and it was soooooo good.  And to top it off I ate the entire entree simply because it tasted so good.   Service was ok.  I sat at the bar which is typical for me on business travel.  Bartender was nice enough but took a while to take my order and also cash me out.  I'd still return and order the same meal if it's on the menu.

This was my first time here and i received a very very warm welcoming.   They addressed me by name which was very nice and felt respected.    The food was amazing ordered the bbq chicken pizza.  The manager gave me a free flatbread because it was my first time being there which was very nice.   Very comfortable environment,  clean and noise level was cool.   Staff was very friendly and made you feel at home.  Great customer service from employee patti  Received a free gift bag which was awesome.  Will be coming back

Update on my experience: I've changed this review due to the fact the manager Brian reached out to me and I discussed the issue with him. I'm a regular at cpk and this review was based on one person. So I've edited my review to 5stars because I come here weekly and the service is always good, just not this one time.  I come to Cpk all the time. I always order the bbq chicken salad which is my favorite salad of all time. The food was great but the waitress we had needs to work on it. My daughter asked her for flavored tea so she offered to bring 2 diff syrups she can try, when she returned to the table she brought her a lemonade. She clearly was confused and not listening because we didn't order a lemonade. Then we asked her for bread as she did not automatically bring it to our table with the drinks. She again forgot that. I had to ask the waitress that ended up bringing our food to us to bring bread. Never came by our table to bring refills of my water. Then when I asked for the check and boxes for the pizza and the salad. She brings the Check with only a box for the pizza. Again not listening! Sigh. So I asked for the box again. This was the worse service I've experienced at cpk.

I love coming in here to grab a quick bite or drinks. We stopped in here for drinks at the bar. I tried their new Watermelon Mint martini, it was so refreshing and delicious.  The service at the bar was great.  One of my all time favorite dishes here is the Kung pao spaghetti. Its combining two of my favorite foods; Kung Pao chicken and Spaghetti. I always order this whether we are dining in or grabbing this to go. They also have to go pick up option.

We came here last night for dinner it was great. it was real busy so service at the table took a while but we understood. server apologized. the bartender was also real nice. very attentive we had a few drinks. we would come here again. the experience was nice.
Ordered a pizza off of Door Dash since my toddler is sick. Came hard, cold, dry and burnt. Soooo disappointing.
Whatever your favorite recipe is you will find it here.  I like the 5 cheese pizza and the halibut dish. The free refills on the drinks is awesome! Family-friendly and good service.

Very disappointed in the pizza here, I got the club pizza had a few bites and the waiter asked if I liked it and I said no, not at all. Disposing when he didn't ask to change it or take it back, what a waste of money and bad service. Don't have any reason to go back to CPK if they take away my favorite pizza - pear with Gorgonzola:(

Penne creme pasta (with chicken added) is everything it should be at this location! Tastes freshly made although I highly doubt it, but there was plenty of chicken and a hearty portion size. It also came out quickly, which I can never get used to. My friend and I were in and out of there in 45 minutes. I also felt like splurging so I got the flavored lemonade...I had forgotten how yummy that was until I was consuming it on a hot, Riverside day. Highly recommend and unlimited refills! Above all, the service was excellent. We were attended to by an older woman and she was all over the place, helping us and getting us a double order of bread (thanks!). She was such a sweetheart and made the quickie a good one. Really appreciate it.

It is sad that good food does not always guarantee good service.  We had a large party (12), arriving for reserved dinner at 6:30. So it's not like we weren't expected.  Unfortunately for this staff on a Wednesday evening, we apparently were too much for the cook. Credit the waiter for trying his best, but he failed to bring any information on why there was a long delay in service. None of us had our orders at 7:45. Thus, the manager was summoned.    Perhaps another cook would be beneficial in granting more stars for this particular restaurant.  That said, my Crunchy Thai salad was delicious. But not worth waiting for over an hour. Update Added 10/12/17: To my surprise, management went above and beyond to rectify the 2 star rating I initially gave this restaurant!  It's highly likely I will return soon, because they've practicality begged, haha, but in all seriousness, their menu selections really are delicious

A quickie before the movie, CPK was a good choice overall. Since I arrived first I ordered for my friends who arrived just in time. I figured sitting at the bar would expedite the process, while not super smooth, we were accommodated well and received the food and drinks before showtime.  Cudos to the gal bartender who made me the delicious and refreshing Blueberry Ginger Smash cocktail featured on the menu. 5-stars for presentation and balanced taste (meaning alcohol was detected). I also had Samuel Adam's Summer Alex. Food: Appetizers, including the really delicious Avocado Roll. While I don't eat ranch dressing or its derivatives (I developed a lifetime aversion working in restaurants during undergrad), I found them delightful as is. Cut into six pieces it served three just fine. Next was the Flatbread, but I thought the price to value ratio quite low on account of the anemic size of the portion. While it tasted good, I'd certainly never order it again.  We paid and left. While not the top of my list, the clean and modern interior does create a relaxed atmosphere.

The staff is always top notch here. You get awesome service, the managers stop by to check on you, and the servers top off your tea before you have time to get dehydrated. They have a rewards program so make sure to check it out.  The butter cake with vanilla ice cream is almost the best thing I could have on my mouth. It just melts. I have to get it every time. I'd order it first since I never eat all of my dinner which is usually always kung pao spaghetti with shrimp.  I just recently ordered the steak, and it was fabulous.  Way to go CPK.

I do think CPK has stepped up their game a bit. Plenty of menu options besides just pizza, healthy offerings as well. I enjoy their soups and salads and even the salmon here was pretty good. Service was fine, food came out quickly. Portions are descent, but it is a bit pricey for chain restaurant food. My Reviews Preface: People have different taste buds and preferences. Some may like their food more/less salty, spicy, and seasoned, etc. Some may prefer mom-n-pops restaurants, others more fancy or both. Some prefer fresh & organic ingredients; others just want their food to taste "good". As far as customer service, I think that can be tricky based on people's personalities. So, I'm of the opinion that you try the place your looking to eat at & judge for yourself, unless there are horrid reviews of course. My Review: Food: "White Corn Guacamole + Chips" - wasn't very impressed. Had no flavor and I was expecting to be what the menu described in it's title and that is "Guacamole". It was more like small chunks of avocado mixed with the other ingredients. ALTHOUGH, in their defense, the menu did state diced avocado, HOWEVER, I expected it to have somewhat of a creamy consistency throughout. I wouldn't have this appetizer again.  Next, "Chicken Tequila Fettuccine": the pasta was not quite Al Dente, it was a hair under cooked but tolerable. At first glance, it was not an appetizing looking dish, it looked mostly "earth toned" and that didn't appeal to me. The taste, however, surprised me. I wasn't expecting it to taste good since I didn't like what I saw initially and it was also creamy. All the flavors described, however, did not deliver. I couldn't taste the tequila (nor was I expecting a strong flavor to come through) but I could taste a bit of the jalapeno, although it didn't hit the right spicy notes that I particularly wanted. Although it wasn't tasteless, I wouldn't try this dish again. Atmosphere: typical restaurant food chain Customer Service: Hostess was pleasant, greeted us well. Server was nice, not extremely attentive during the course of our lunch but I don;t prefer all the fuss while I eat anyway, just for my server to be available should I need anything further. Cleanliness: Adequate, at least in the eating area Price: typical price for such a restaurant $$ but I don't think the pricing was appropriate to the quality of food I received. Timing of Food: acceptable Overall: I would dine here again to try something else. Although it is a chain, I believe that our experience can vary from different restaurants due to who the cooks are and management of course.

It's the night before Mr.GC leaves to Pittsburgh, so what does that mean... he's not even close to being ready. But thanks to me I'm showing off my grand master skills in packing. But before we do this chore, we grab a bite to eat for pick up. I tried something new in ordering. I did the online route. It was quick and easy. It gave options for date of meal, what is the time we wanted, too... the choice of curbside, pickups or delivery. We had plans to have a drink at the bar while we picked up our order. We walked in sat at the bar. Bartender asked what we would like, I told him I had placed an online order he said ok,but we would like to have a drink, he said no problem, let me get your name and check your order. He said it will be ready in a few min do you still want it to go. Mr.GC and I both said yes. I saw on the menu a new drink called Cha Cha Agua Fresca it really was refreshing. This is an alcoholic drink I might add. It had a chilly spice you could taste at the back of your throat. Mr.GC had a little sip while he enjoyed his tall blonde beer. Are meal was ready in no time, the bartender asked if there was anything else we would like extra; oils cheese,bread. We said yep, to all those things. Mr.GC's favorite meal is the tequila lime pasta w/chicken, I tried one of their new dishes. The spicy Chinese spaghetti w/ added chicken & shrimp. I have to say I was surprised on how spicy it really was; it definitely had a kick. Would totally order the drink and meal again while using the online ordering service. Made the beginning of the night run smooth knowing we had a lot to do before Mr.GC left at 4am.
